newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: UBS sees no Motor-Columbus deal this year.
newsitem.headline: UBS sees no Motor-Columbus deal this year.

text.p: Union Bank of Switzerland said it was moving closer to a decision on selling its stake in energy holding Motor-Columbus but that a deal was not likely by the end of this year.
"It is coming to an end," UBS Chief Executive Mathis Cabialavetta told a news conference when asked when the bank group would get rid of the stake.
"I cannot say when, things are in flux," he added.
"But the chance of a deal that would have a financial effect by the end of this year is not very probable," he said.
UBS has long said it wants to sell most or all of its 74.1 percent stake in Motor-Columbus, whose main asset is its 55.8 percent share in Swiss power utility Aare Tessin AG fuer Elektrizitaet (ATEL).
